      About
      4.5
      Excellent
      19,892 reviews
      Location
      Cleanliness
      Service
      Value
      Certificate of Excellence
      GreenLeaders Gold level
      Situated opposite Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament, Park Plaza Westminster Bridge London places guests at the heart of central London. The London Eye, the London Aquarium and the city’s finest theatres, restaurants and bars are just steps away. The contemporary guestrooms and suites include large family-friendly Studio Rooms with bedroom, bathroom, kitchenette and living space with pull-out sofa bed. Enhanced amenities and extra space are on offer in the chic Penthouses and Suites. Dining options include Brasserie Joël, Ichi Sushi & Sashimi, 1WB Lounge & Patisserie and Primo Bar. The hotel also boasts a fitness centre with a 15-metre pool and Mandara Spa.

      Neighborhood
      Southbank
      Big time attractions such as the London Eye and a thriving theatre scene (compliments of the National Theatre and the Young Vic) are but a few of the reasons that Southbank is such a collectively cherished part of town. With plenty of family friendly activities and venues lined up along a pedestrianized river bank between Westminster Bridge and Waterloo Bridge, visitors can always expect a casual and festive atmosphere. On top of all the fun stuff to do at Southbank is the opportunity to simply sit back and admire photo-op views of iconic landmarks like Parliament and St Paul's Cathedral, just on across the Thames.

      Grantasuarus asked a question
      Park Plaza Westminster Bridge LondonJan 1
      Hello, I have a prepaid reservation for your hotel, I was wondering instead of using debit/credit card, could I leave a cash deposit for incidentals?
      Answer from sitestudio
      Jan 11 |
      They did not appear setup to handle cash. They demanded my card for the deposit before check-in, even with a pre-paid room, and allot of money, over 500 GBP and there was an erroneous charge on my bill at checkout. Mind your invoice and check out in-person and do not opt for expedited checkout they where you cannot review your final bill in person. I also did not like that they asked if I wanted to set the deposit in USD or GBP. This is a known scam and shameful. Let your bank set the conversion rate not the hotel. Pay in the currency of the county you are in.
